value.name: New EU anti-migrant deal will help Rishi Sunak ‘stop the boats’, claims French politician
value.description: French MEP Fabienne Keller, of the Renew Europe group, who led the negotiations, insisted the Geneva Convention will be “fully applied” in the so-called waiting zones, adding: “If I may make a comparison, instead of sending people to Rwanda, we are doing it on European soil.”

video.name: New EU anti-migrant deal will help Rishi Sunak ‘stop the boats’, claims French politician

value.name: Troubles legacy act: Ireland takes human rights case against UK
value.description: The UK's controversial Troubles legacy act became law in September, despite opposition from Dublin and all Northern Ireland's main political parties. Critics argued the law gave an amnesty and removed access to justice. Northern Ireland Secretary Chris Heaton-Harris said he "profoundly regrets" the Irish decision.

value.name: Theatre Royal panto has so much power in the community
value.description: Panto is many people's first introduction to the theatre, hopefully igniting a lifelong love of live performance. We cannot know the true effects into the future of this creative experience at this moment, but we are committed to everyone having that opportunity. The theatre industry relies upon it.

value.name: Esther Rantzen's desperate appeal to MPs as she joins Dignitas after stage four cancer diagnosis
value.description: Veteran journalist and presenter Dame Esther Rantzen, 83, urged parliamentarians to think of the elderly people in their lives and whether they'd want them to spend their final days in agony or to offer them a "gentle,

value.name: Dublin says it has 'no choice' but to take legal action over UK's Northern Ireland amnesty law - as British government slams the move as 'unnecessary'
value.description: The new Troubles legacy act became law in September and gives conditional amnesties to former soldiers and militants involved in decades of violence.

value.name: Green ministers condemned after just transition and transport budgets cut
value.description: The Lib Dems said Scottish Government funding decisions will mean more use of petrol cars, and oil and gas, and ‘more sewage in our rivers’.

value.name: Most dangerous holiday destinations in 2024 mapped as tourists warned of 'risk'
value.description: Tourists have been warned against going to a number of holiday destinations in 2024 amid political unrest and climate change. International SOS has revealed the places most likely to result in issues for travellers due to factors including violence and crime.

value.name: Losing Andrew Bridgen may herald the dying days of the Reclaim Party
value.description: FAR-right conspiracy theorist nutjob MP Andrew Bridgen was thrown out of the Tory party for comparing the vaccine rollout to the Holocaust.

value.name: UK Government ‘profoundly regrets’ legal action by Irish against Legacy Act
value.description: Irish premier Leo Varadkar said the ‘strong’ legal advice was that the legislation breached the UN Convention on Human Rights.

value.name: Wellingborough byelection gives Labour another chance to humiliate Rishi Sunak
value.description: Recall of MP Peter Bone opens up Brexit-leaning former safe seat where defections from Tories in any direction could help Labour win

value.name: Terror scout caught spying on broadcaster’s London base
value.description: A terror scout spied on a dissident Iranian television channel in the UK, a court heard, as counter-terror police revealed they had foiled 15 plots linked to Iran.

value.name: Gavin Williamson criticises Boris Johnson’s ‘panic’ pandemic school closures
value.description: The ex-education secretary said Mr Johnson’s decision to shut schools in January 2021 did not ‘sufficiently take children’s interests into account’.

value.name: DUP questions if Rebublic's Legacy Act legal action will strain UK relations
value.description: Politicians welcome the interstate case challenging Troubles Legacy bill as Sir Jeffrey Donaldson questions it | UTV News

value.name: 2024 will be the year the housing crisis dwarfs the cost of living
value.description: The real story of 2024 may well be that the cost of living crisis will be replaced by a cost of housing crisis. Even if wages finally outpace inflation, and even if some food and energy prices ease, the sheer difficulty in paying a rent or mortgage may further undermine any sense of security.

value.name: Jeffrey Donaldson slams Dublin over attack on UK amnesty law: 'Ireland has had an amnesty for terrorists for years'
value.description: The Irish Government has been challenged to say what it is doing to deal with Troubles' legacy cases in its jurisdiction by DUP leader Sir Jeffrey Donaldson.

value.name: 'Political pantomime' must end now that talks have concluded: Robbie Butler
value.description: The “political pantomime” in Northern Ireland must end as the legislation governing the post-Brexit trading arrangements is not going to change, Robbie Butler has said.

value.name: The Human League announce North East date with tickets on sale Friday
value.description: The experimental electronic band, who formed in 1977 and are going strong more than 45 years later, are the latest addition to the summer line-up at Herrington Country Park where they will take to the stage in July. Tickets to the show will go on sale this Friday, December 22.
